Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2007 03:42PM kam54 wrote: Trigeek-I also have Invasive lobular, 2.5 cm on left and micro on the right.  Sentinel node showed 1 positive on left and 1 positive on right.  I fought radiation with my dr and thought I would rather have surgery, but both my onc and surgeon said it would be much better to do rads on my nodes and not go back for more surgery.  Well I am doing radition and have done 20 of 33 treatments.  I am doing chestwall, ax nodes and clavical nodes on both sides.  I have been told that radiated nodes do recover somewhat, but still there is a substantial chance of lymphedema, and the radiation will kill small micro cancers, but not large cancers. I am very very red and purple/sore under my arms and am thinking about stopping with the radition.  I don't know if this is wise or not, I will speak to my doctor tomorrow.  She is very aggressive and I am sure will try and talk me out of it, but I think I have had enough.  I am so very concerned about the skin damage, node damage and just the after effects of radiation.  Many of the other posts have been more positive regarding radiation, so I hope someone else response to you also.  Good luck.

Posts.Content: kam54 wrote: I am considering stopping radiation. I have had 20 treatments so far and because of low white count I skipped 2 treatments last week. Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2007 10:31PM kam54 wrote: I had low white count during chemo even with the Neulasta shot, but not as low as CrystalCats.  I am presently on rads finished #20 last week and my white count was low so they stopped the treatments for a week to let it come back up.  It is not rare but not very often for rads to effect your white count from my understanding.  So with your history, you better take care on what you eat.  Good luck.
